problem.markdown:
>>What does \(s\) in m\m\s system stand for? <<
( ) The limit of the queue size. (x) The number of servers. ( ) The number of lines in the system. ( ) The number of customers in the line.
[explanation] \(s\) stands for the number of servers in the system. When s=1, it is equivalent to an m/m/1 system. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.label: What does \(s\) in m\m\s system stand for?

choicegroup.choice: The limit of the queue size.
The number of lines in the system.
The number of customers in the line.

div.p: \(s\) stands for the number of servers in the system. When s=1, it is equivalent to an m/m/1 system.
